intro: Palicourea boyanii, commonly known as the Brazilian pepper tree, is a species of flowering plant in the family Rubiaceae. It is native to the Atlantic coastal forests of Brazil and is characterized by its small, fragrant white flowers and elliptical leaves. The plant produces small, red, fleshy berries that are a food source for various birds and mammals. It is often found in moist, shaded environments and can thrive in a variety of soil types. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens, though it can become invasive in certain regions.
